associated_reports.name: Ready For Follow Up
associated_reports.description: Participants with an appointment set that are ready for specific follow up activities.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT
   dt.master_id,
   ipa.ipa_id,
   --pi.first_name,
   --pi.last_name,
   dt.source,
   dt.extra_log_type activity,
   dt.communication_result,
   dt.checklist_signed,
   dt.exit_type,
   dt.created_at,
   dt.r
FROM (
  -- Generate a resultset of ranked results
  -- with most recently created items first
  -- that include only the requested previous and outstanding activities
  -- This allows us to see if an outstanding item appears more recently than
  -- a previous item

  SELECT
    di.*,
    dlo.exit_type,
    rank()
    OVER (
    PARTITION BY di.master_id
    ORDER BY di.created_at DESC
    ) AS r
  FROM
  (
    --
    -- IPA Tracker process
    --
    SELECT
      al.master_id,
      'tracker' "source",
      al.extra_log_type,
      CASE WHEN
        (select_result='follow up' OR select_activity = 'schedule follow up') THEN 'follow up'
      WHEN
        (select_result='completed' OR select_activity = 'completed') THEN 'completed'
      ELSE
        al.select_result
      END "communication_result",
      NULL "checklist_signed",
      al.created_at

    FROM activity_log_ipa_assignments al

    WHERE
      'appointment-set' = 'general-follow-up' AND al.extra_log_type='general' AND (select_result='follow up' OR select_activity = 'schedule follow up')
      OR 'appointment-set' = 'general-completed' AND al.extra_log_type='general' AND (select_result='completed' OR select_activity = 'completed')
      OR :activity_outstanding is not null AND :activity_outstanding = 'general-follow-up' AND al.extra_log_type='general'
      OR :activity_outstanding is not null AND :activity_outstanding = 'general-completed' AND al.extra_log_type='general'
      OR al.extra_log_type IN ('appointment-set', :activity_outstanding)

    UNION

    --
    -- IPA Tracker process for Transportation
    --
    SELECT
      distinct al.master_id,
      'transportation' "source",
      al.extra_log_type,
      NULL "communication_result",
      NULL "checklist_signed",
      al.created_at

    FROM activity_log_ipa_assignments al
    INNER JOIN ipa_transportations tr
    ON tr.master_id = al.master_id

    WHERE
      :activity_outstanding is not null AND :activity_outstanding = 'transportation' AND al.extra_log_type='transportation_and_housing'

    UNION
    
    --
    -- IPA Tracker process for Housing
    --
    SELECT
      distinct al.master_id,
      'housing' "source",
      al.extra_log_type,
      NULL "communication_result",
      NULL "checklist_signed",
      al.created_at

    FROM activity_log_ipa_assignments al
    INNER JOIN ipa_hotels h
    ON h.master_id = al.master_id

    WHERE
      :activity_outstanding is not null AND :activity_outstanding = 'housing' AND al.extra_log_type='transportation_and_housing'

    UNION
     
    --
    -- IPA Tracker process for appointments
    --
    SELECT
      al.master_id,
      'tracker' "source",
      al.extra_log_type,
      NULL "communication_result",
      NULL "checklist_signed",
      created_at

    FROM activity_log_ipa_assignments al

    -- INNER JOIN ipa_appointments apt
    -- ON al.master_id = apt.master_id

    WHERE
      'appointment-set' = 'appointment-set' AND al.extra_log_type='appointment'
      OR :activity_outstanding is not null AND :activity_outstanding = 'appointment-set' AND al.extra_log_type='appointment'


  ) AS di

  LEFT OUTER JOIN (
    -- Add an exit type column for those participants that have exited the study
    -- NULL if they are still in the study

    --
    -- Phone Screen not interested or not eligible
    --
    SELECT
      master_id,
      'not interested or ineligible (follow up)' "exit_type"


    FROM ipa_screenings ps
    WHERE
      still_interested_blank_yes_no = 'no' OR
      eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no = 'no'


    UNION

    --
    -- Phone screen not interested
    --
    SELECT
      master_id,
      'not interested (phone screening)' "exit_type"

    FROM ipa_ps_initial_screenings inits
    WHERE
     select_is_good_time_to_speak = 'not interested' OR
     select_may_i_begin = 'not interested' OR
     select_still_interested = 'no'

    UNION

    --
    -- Withdrew
    --
    SELECT
      master_id,
      'withdrew' "exit_type"

    FROM ipa_withdrawals wd
    WHERE
     select_subject_withdrew_reason = 'withdrew' OR
     select_investigator_terminated IN ('yes - due to ae', 'yes - other reason') OR
     lost_to_follow_up_no_yes = 'yes' OR
     no_longer_participating_no_yes = 'yes'

     UNION

    --
    -- Completed study
    --
    SELECT
      master_id,
      'completed exit survey' "exit_type"
    FROM ipa_surveys surv
    WHERE
      select_survey_type = 'exit survey'

  -- End left outer join
  ) dlo ON dlo.master_id = di.master_id

-- End ranked selection
) AS dt

-- Include player details
inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
-- Match IPA ID to master_id
inner join ipa_assignments ipa on dt.master_id = ipa.master_id

WHERE
(
  -- Either:
  -- no outstanding activity has been selected, so just perform a plain query
  -- or:
  -- we want the first record from the results based
  -- on an order of most recently created appearing first (and therefore overriding older records)
  :activity_outstanding IS NULL OR :activity_outstanding IS NOT NULL AND r = 1
)
AND
(
  -- Based on the activity performed selection pick the appropriate conditions
  'appointment-set' = 'general-follow-up' AND extra_log_type='general' AND dt.communication_result='follow up'
  OR 'appointment-set' = 'general-completed' AND extra_log_type='general' AND dt.communication_result='completed'
  OR 'appointment-set' = 'inex-phone-screen-finalized' AND extra_log_type = 'finalize_phone_screen_checklist'
  OR 'appointment-set' = 'inex-phone-screen-so-pi' AND extra_log_type = 'sign_phone_screen'
  OR 'appointment-set' = 'inex-phone-screen-so-mednav' AND extra_log_type = 'sign_phone_screen_reviewer'
  OR 'appointment-set' = 'inex-phone-screen-so-staff' AND extra_log_type = 'sign_phone_screen_staff'
  OR 'appointment-set' = 'inex-tms-responses' AND extra_log_type = 'tms_responses'
  OR 'appointment-set' = 'inex-tms-so' AND extra_log_type = 'sign_tms_eligibility'
  OR 'appointment-set' = 'phone-screen-complete' AND extra_log_type = 'phone_screen_finalized'
  OR 'appointment-set' = 'has-planned-event' AND extra_log_type = 'planned_event'
  OR 'appointment-set' = 'has-event-feedback' AND extra_log_type = 'station_event'
  OR 'appointment-set' = 'appointment-set' AND extra_log_type='appointment'

  OR (
    'appointment-set' = 'inex-baseline-complete'
    AND (
      extra_log_type IN ('sign_baseline') AND
      checklist_signed = 'yes'
    )
  )

  OR 'appointment-set' NOT IN ('inex-complete', 'phone-screen-complete') AND extra_log_type = 'appointment-set'
)
AND (
  -- If no outstanding activity was selected then there are no conditions to apply
  :activity_outstanding IS NULL
  OR NOT (
    -- An outstanding activity was selected
    -- Based on the activity outstanding selection pick the appropriate conditions
    -- that the first record in the results must match in order to correctly override the previous activities
    -- If one was found, the NOT negation ensures a found record does not register as an activity outstanding
    r = 1
    AND (
      :activity_outstanding = 'general-follow-up' AND extra_log_type='general' AND dt.communication_result='follow up'
      OR :activity_outstanding = 'general-completed' AND extra_log_type='general' AND dt.communication_result='completed'
      OR :activity_outstanding = 'inex-phone-screen-finalized' AND extra_log_type = 'finalize_phone_screen_checklist'
      OR :activity_outstanding = 'inex-phone-screen-so-pi' AND extra_log_type = 'sign_phone_screen'
      OR :activity_outstanding = 'inex-phone-screen-so-mednav' AND extra_log_type = 'sign_phone_screen_reviewer'
      OR :activity_outstanding = 'inex-phone-screen-so-staff' AND extra_log_type = 'sign_phone_screen_staff'
      OR :activity_outstanding = 'inex-tms-responses' AND extra_log_type = 'tms_responses'
      OR :activity_outstanding = 'inex-tms-so' AND extra_log_type = 'sign_tms_eligibility'
      OR :activity_outstanding = 'phone-screen-complete' AND extra_log_type = 'phone_screen_finalized'
      OR :activity_outstanding = 'has-planned-event' AND extra_log_type = 'planned_event'
      OR :activity_outstanding = 'has-event-feedback' AND extra_log_type = 'station_event'
      OR :activity_outstanding = 'appointment-set' AND extra_log_type='appointment'

      OR (
          :activity_outstanding = 'inex-baseline-complete'
          AND (
            extra_log_type IN ('sign_baseline') AND
            checklist_signed = 'yes'
          )
      )


      OR :activity_outstanding NOT IN ('inex-complete', 'phone-screen-complete') AND extra_log_type = :activity_outstanding
    )
  )

)

AND (
  'in_study' IS NULL
  OR (
    'in_study' = 'in_study' AND dt.exit_type IS NULL
    OR
    'in_study' = 'not_in_study' AND dt.exit_type IS NOT NULL
  )
)
ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;

associated_reports.name: IPA Calendar
associated_reports.sql:
create temp table nav_events
as select
'' "-",
al.event_date,
al.start_time,
pi.master_id,
ipa.ipa_id,
pi.first_name,
pi.last_name,
al.extra_log_type,
al.select_status,
al.select_station,
al.select_event_type,
al.other_event_type,
al.completion_time,
al.arrival_time,
al.select_navigator,
al.select_pi,
al.location
from
activity_log_ipa_assignment_navigations al
inner join player_infos pi
on pi.master_id = al.master_id
inner join ipa_assignments ipa
on ipa.master_id = al.master_id

where
(:from_date IS NULL or event_date >= :from_date)
AND (:to_date IS NULL or event_date <= :to_date)
AND ((:type) IS NULL or extra_log_type in (:type))
AND ((:confirmed) IS NULL or select_status in (:confirmed))
AND ((:station) IS NULL or select_station in (:station))
AND (:ipa_id IS NULL or ipa.ipa_id = :ipa_id)
;


create temp table appointments
as select
visit_start_date,
coalesce(select_schedule, '') select_schedule,
ap.master_id,
ipa.ipa_id,
pi.first_name,
pi.last_name,
max(ap.id) appointment_id
from ipa_appointments ap
inner join activity_log_ipa_assignments al
on al.master_id = ap.master_id

inner join player_infos pi
on ap.master_id = pi.master_id

inner join ipa_assignments ipa
on ipa.master_id = al.master_id


where
  visit_start_date IS NOT NULL
  AND (:from_date IS NULL or visit_start_date >= :from_date)
  AND (:to_date IS NULL or visit_start_date <= :to_date)
  AND (:ipa_id IS NULL or ipa.ipa_id = :ipa_id)
GROUP BY
ap.master_id, visit_start_date, pi.first_name, pi.last_name, ipa.ipa_id, select_schedule
;

create temp table scheduled_calls
as select
  dt.follow_up_when,
  dt.follow_up_time,
  dt.master_id,
  ipa.ipa_id,
  p.first_name,
  p.last_name,
  dt.extra_log_type,
  dt.select_who
from
  (
    select a.master_id,
      a.extra_log_type,
      a.select_who,
      a.follow_up_when,
      a.follow_up_time,
      a.notes,
      rank()
    OVER (
      PARTITION BY a.master_id, a.extra_log_type
      ORDER BY a.created_at DESC
    ) AS r

    from activity_log_ipa_assignments a
    where
      follow_up_when is not null
      AND (:from_date IS NULL OR follow_up_when >= :from_date)
      AND (:to_date IS NULL OR follow_up_when <= :to_date )
  ) dt
inner join player_infos p
  on dt.master_id = p.master_id

inner join ipa_assignments ipa
  on dt.master_id = ipa.master_id

WHERE r = 1
AND (:ipa_id IS NULL or ipa.ipa_id = :ipa_id)
;

create temp table all_dates
as
select event_date from nav_events
union
select follow_up_when from scheduled_calls
union
select visit_start_date from appointments
;

SELECT
  false::boolean "allDay",
  al.event_date::varchar || 'T' || al.start_time::varchar "start",
  al.event_date::varchar || 'T' || al.completion_time::varchar "end",
  ipa_id || ': ' || al.select_station || ' ' || al.select_event_type || ' ' || al.other_event_type "title",
  array['report-cal-nav-event'] "classNames",
  '/masters/' || master_id "url"
FROM nav_events al

UNION


SELECT
  true ,
  visit_start_date::varchar || 'T' || '00:00:00' ,
  null ,
  ipa_id || ': ' || 'appointment start ' ||
  CASE WHEN select_schedule <> '' THEN '(Group ' || upper(select_schedule) || ')'
  ELSE ''
  END
  ,
  array['report-cal-start-event'] "classNames",
  '/masters/' || master_id "url"
FROM appointments


UNION

SELECT
  false,
  follow_up_when::varchar || 'T' || follow_up_time::varchar,
  NULL,
  ipa_id || ': ' || '(call) ' || replace(extra_log_type, '_', ' '),
  array['report-cal-call-event'] "classNames",
  '/masters/' || master_id "url"
FROM scheduled_calls


;

to_date:

type:

    all: true

confirmed:

    from activity_log_ipa_assignments a
    where
      follow_up_when is not null
      AND (:from_date IS NULL OR follow_up_when >= :from_date)
      AND (:to_date IS NULL OR follow_up_when <= :to_date )
  ) dt
inner join player_infos p
  on dt.master_id = p.master_id

inner join ipa_assignments ipa
  on dt.master_id = ipa.master_id

WHERE r = 1
AND (:ipa_id IS NULL or ipa.ipa_id = :ipa_id)
;

create temp table all_dates
as
select event_date from nav_events
union
select follow_up_when from scheduled_calls
union
select visit_start_date from appointments
;

SELECT
  al.event_date "date",
  al.start_time "start time",
  'assessment event' "-",
  al.extra_log_type "type",
  select_navigator "assigned to",
  select_pi "assigned to pi",
  al.master_id,
  al.ipa_id "IPA ID",
  --al.first_name "first name",
  --al.last_name "last name",
  al.select_status "status",
  al.select_station "station",
  al.select_event_type "event type",
  al.other_event_type "other event type",
  al.location,
  al.completion_time "planned or actual completion time",
  al.arrival_time "arrival time"

FROM nav_events al

UNION

SELECT
  date_trunc('week', dd)::date,
  NULL,
  '          ',
  '          ',
  '          ',
  NULL,
  NULL,
  NULL,
  --'          ',
  --'          ',
  '          ',
  '          ',
  '          ',
  '          ',
  NULL,
  NULL,
  NULL
FROM generate_series
      ( (select min(event_date)::timestamp from all_dates)
      , (select max(event_date)::timestamp from all_dates)
      , '7 day'::interval) dd

UNION

SELECT
  visit_start_date event_date,
  NULL,
  'appointment start',
  '',
  '' "assigned to",
  '' "assigned to pi",
  master_id,
  ipa_id,
  --first_name,
  --last_name,
  '',
  '',
  '',
  '',
  NULL,
  NULL,
  NULL
FROM appointments

UNION

SELECT
  follow_up_when,
  follow_up_time,
  'scheduled call' "-",
  extra_log_type,
  select_who "assigned to",
  '' "assigned to pi",
  master_id,
  ipa_id,
  --first_name,
  --last_name,
  '',
  '',
  '',
  '',
  NULL,
  NULL,
  NULL
FROM scheduled_calls


order by
"date",
"start time"
;

associated_reports.name: Participant Status
associated_reports.sql:
create temp table temp_activities as

select 
master_id,
created_at,
case when extra_log_type = 'schedule_screening' then 'tracker: scheduled screening'
  when extra_log_type in ('schedule_informant_screener', 'screening_follow_up', 'perform_screening_follow_up') then 'tracker: screening follow up'
  when extra_log_type = 'appointment' then 'tracker: appointment set'
  when extra_log_type = 'withdraw' then 'tracker: withdrew'
  when extra_log_type = 'follow_up_surveys' then 'tracker: completed'
  else extra_log_type end "extra_log_type"
from activity_log_ipa_assignments
where extra_log_type in (
  'schedule_screening', 
  'schedule_informant_screener',
  'screening_follow_up',
  'perform_screening_follow_up',
  'appointment',
  'withdraw',
  'follow_up_surveys'
)

UNION

select 
master_id,
created_at,
case when extra_log_type = 'finalize' then  'phone screen: complete' 
else 'phone screen: started' end "extra_log_type"
from activity_log_ipa_assignment_phone_screens

UNION

select 
master_id,
created_at,
case when extra_log_type in (
  'baseline_review'
) then 'in/ex: baseline review'
 when extra_log_type in (
  'sign_baseline_staff',
  'sign_baseline'
) then 'in/ex: baseline review complete'
 when extra_log_type in (
  'phone_screen_review'
) then 'in/ex: phone screen review'

 when extra_log_type in (
  'sign_phone_screen_staff', 
  'sign_phone_screen_reviewer', 
  'sign_phone_screen'
) then 'in/ex: phone screen review complete'

else 'in/ex: phone screen review' end "extra_log_type"

from activity_log_ipa_assignment_inex_checklists
where extra_log_type in (
  'phone_screen_review', 
  'sign_phone_screen_staff', 
  'sign_phone_screen_reviewer', 
  'sign_phone_screen',
  'baseline_review',
  'sign_baseline_staff',
  'sign_baseline'
  )


UNION

select 
master_id,
created_at,
case 
  when extra_log_type = 'add_mrn' then 'navigation: added mrn'
  when extra_log_type = 'planned_event' then 'navigation: planned event'
  when extra_log_type = 'station_event' then 'navigation: completed event'
  else 'navigation: ' || extra_log_type end "extra_log_type"

from activity_log_ipa_assignment_navigations
where extra_log_type in (
  'add_mrn', 
  'planned_event',
  'station_event'
)

UNION

select 
master_id,
created_at,
case when extra_log_type = 'exit_interview' then 'medical navigation: exit interview'
  when extra_log_type = 'two_wk_followup' then 'medical navigation: two week follow up'
  when extra_log_type = 'four_wk_followup' then 'medical navigation: four week follow up'
  end "extra_log_type"
from activity_log_ipa_assignment_med_navs
where 
extra_log_type in (
  'exit_interview',
  'two_wk_followup',
  'four_wk_followup'
)

UNION

select
master_id,
now(), -- Force the result to be the latest
'phone screen: exited' "extra_log_type"
from ipa_ps_initial_screenings
WHERE
  select_is_good_time_to_speak = 'not interested' 
  OR select_may_i_begin = 'not interested'
  OR select_still_interested = 'no'

UNION
  
select 
  master_id,
  now(),
  'follow up: ineligible' "extra_log_type"
  from ipa_screenings
  where
    ipa_screenings.eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no = 'no'
    OR ipa_screenings.still_interested_blank_yes_no = 'no'

;


select count(*) "count", ta.extra_log_type "status"
from temp_activities ta
inner join 
  player_infos pi on pi.master_id = ta.master_id and (
    pi.first_name <> 'test' and pi.last_name <> 'test'
  )
inner join 
(
  select max(ta2.created_at) "created_at", ta2.master_id
  from temp_activities ta2
  where ta2.master_id = master_id
  group by ta2.master_id
) tres
on ta.master_id = tres.master_id and ta.created_at = tres.created_at

group by ta.extra_log_type
;

associated_reports.name: Screenings & Enrollments
associated_reports.sql:
create temp table temp_counts as
select count(*) "screening_count", t.created_at 
from 
(
  select 
  al.master_id, max(al.created_at) "created_at"
  from activity_log_ipa_assignment_phone_screens al
  where al.extra_log_type = 'finalize'
  group by al.master_id
) t

inner join player_infos pi on t.master_id = pi.master_id and pi.first_name <> 'test' and pi.last_name <> 'test'
group by t.created_at;


create temp table temp_count_apps as
select count(*) "enrollment_count", t.created_at 
from 
(
  select 
  al.master_id, max(al.created_at) "created_at"
  from activity_log_ipa_assignments al
  where al.extra_log_type = 'appointment'
  group by al.master_id
) t

inner join player_infos pi on t.master_id = pi.master_id and pi.first_name <> 'test' and pi.last_name <> 'test'
group by t.created_at;


create temp table temp_ca as
select created_at
from temp_counts 
union
select created_at
from temp_count_apps;

select
  all_c.created_at "started when",
  sum("screening_count") over(order by all_c.created_at asc rows between unbounded preceding and current row) "screenings" ,
  sum("enrollment_count") over(order by all_c.created_at asc rows between unbounded preceding and current row) "enrollments"  
from temp_ca all_c
left outer join temp_counts cp on all_c.created_at = cp.created_at
left outer join temp_count_apps ca on all_c.created_at = ca.created_at
--order by "started when";

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro
associated_message_templates.template:
Hello, my name is ____, and I am calling from the Football Players Health Study at Harvard University. Is Mr. {{player_info.last_name}} available?

I am reaching out to talk to you about the In-Person Assessment research study. Is this a good time to speak?

Voicemail

Hi, my name is ____ and I’m calling from the Football Players Health Study at Harvard University. When you have a chance please call me back at 617-432-5000. I look forward to speaking with you. Thank you

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro overview
associated_message_templates.template:
As you may know, The Football Players Health Study is a research initiative dedicated to understanding the current health and well-being of former NFL players. The research study that I want to talk to you about today is an In-Person study that focuses on four areas of player health that have been identified by former players such as yourself, as critical areas to be studied – heart function, neurocognitive health (e.g. memory/thinking/problem solving and brain imaging), pain and physical function, and sleep.

The purpose of this study is to obtain in-person measurements of these health conditions in former players. We hope that this will help us better understand the relationship of a professional football career to overall health.

Participation will involve a 2 ½ day study visit in Boston that includes assessments of the four areas. All nights will be spent in a local hotel. The visits will take place at various Harvard-affiliated institutions. Throughout the study, a team of study navigators will guide you through all of the visits. All transportation, meal and lodging costs will be covered by the Study.

By participating, you will be helping us better understand player health. Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to learn more about yourself as we will be providing some results from the clinical assessments at the end of the study. At the participant’s request, these can be shared with a health care provider for further guidance and interpretation.

I am going to go over the study in some more detail. If you have any questions while I explain the study please stop me and ask. Do you have any questions so far?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro details
associated_message_templates.template:
INTERVIEWER: HAVE THE CONSENT FORM ON HAND TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL DETAILS ABOUT THE STUDY VISITS AS NEEDED.

Day 0

Our team will coordinate your arrival to Boston to arrive the day before the study begins. You will check into a local hotel.

Day 1

Day 1 will begin at MGH where you will review the consent form with a study physician and study coordinator. Any specific questions you have will be answered then. You will then go through a DEXA scan, which is similar to an x-ray but looks at bone density. Next, you will have your blood drawn and go through a general assessment of your health similar to a physical at a doctor’s appointment. You will have to fast prior to this blood draw. In the afternoon, you will go through two PET scans, a sense of smell test and a test of your sensory responses. The day will end around 6pm.

  • Consent review: The first day will start with a review of the consent. You will meet with a study coordinator and the study physician in order to review the study assessments and the consent form. During this time, you will be able to ask any questions or voice any concerns you may have.
  • DEXA: Once you have agreed to participate, you will undergo a DEXA scan. A DEXA scan is similar to an x-ray, but it is a scan that looks at bone density and body composition.
  • OGTT: You will then get your blood drawn. Please note that will ask that you do not eat for at least 8 hours prior to this blood draw – we will be sure to remind you when you arrive. You will have breakfast following the blood draw.
  • During the rest of the first day you will:
    • Undergo an assessment of your health such as a review of your medical history, medications, and a brief physical exam that includes body composition measures (e.g. height, weight, waist size…)
    • Fill out some questionnaires about your health
    • PET (Positron Emission Tomography) with CT (Computed Tomography) – PET/CT scans take pictures of what is going on inside the body using special dyes with radiation that “light up” inside the body to make a picture. The scanner is shaped like a big ring and you will be positioned on your back on the scanner table. The table may move forward and backward as part of the testing the procedures. You will complete two different PET scans.
    • Sense of smell testing (olfactory)– This brief test consists of breathing different odors from a small handheld odor delivery device and being asked questions about your familiarity, memory and ability to name each odor.
    • Sensory testing – An assessment that consists of tests to measure your sensory responses – for example, having pressure applied to different parts of your body or putting you hand in ice water – you will be asked to report when these sensations are uncomfortable.
  • The first study night will be spent in the hotel.

Day 2

On the second full study day, you will begin with neuropsychological testing. After this, you will have an MRI of your brain and your liver. In the afternoon, you will travel to a different hospital to do physical functioning testing. After physical functioning, you will go through our TMS and EEG assessment. TMS is noninvasive and uses magnetic fields to measure connectivity in the brain. The day will end at the hotel where you will be set up for the sleep assessment. You will sleep with various sensors on your body to analyze your sleeping patterns.

  • Neuropsychological testing – An assessment that consists of tests that evaluate your mood, memory and how you think, learn and solve problems. This will be conducted with a trained neuropsychologist.
  • MRI (Magnetic resonance imaging) of your brain and liver – This is a scan that takes pictures of your brain and liver using a large magnet and radio signals.
  • Physical function testing – Testing that consists of a series of tests such as lifting weights, a timed walking test, walking upstairs carrying weights, walking while doing another task (simple math), and testing your balance. These assessments will be administered and overseen by a trained exercise physiologist.
  • TMS (Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation) and EEG (Electroencephalogram) – The TMS will measure brain plasticity. Brain plasticity is the ability of the brain to change and learn through experience. TMS is a noninvasive way of stimulating the brain. TMS uses a magnetic field to cause activity in the brain. The magnetic field is produced by a coil that is held next to your scalp. In this study, we will use TMS to create activity in your brain and will measure your brain’s response to the activity. This is how we measure brain plasticity. During the TMS assessment, you will have a series of electrodes (small round discs) will be placed on your head and your brain waves will be measured while you sit quietly and then while you complete a few simple tasks on a computer.
  • Sleep study – During the second night, you will have a sleep study in your hotel room. This will include having sensors placed on your body to monitor your movement, heart rate, breathing and brain waves while you sleep. A trained technician will assist you in placing various sensors on your body, but they will leave you for the night. Additionally, you will be asked to complete several questionnaires on your sleep habits.

Day 3

On the third and final study day, you will begin with cardiac testing and then X-rays. After you have completed all of the assessments, we will be returning some preliminary results from your testing. Our medical navigation nurse will meet with you and discuss some of the results. Some results will be reported to you in the coming weeks and that process will be explained to you at that time.

  • Cardiac testing – This testing consists of activities such as having pictures taken of your heart (ultrasound), assessment of your resting metabolic rate which will include you having to wear light headgear with a breathing tube, and a bicycle exercise test. You will be asked to arrive in a fasting state (not having eaten in 8+ hours). You will be provide with a meal following this assessment.
  • X-rays – You will undergo an X-ray exam, where you will be asked several questions, prepped and asked to stand in the equipment for the duration of the scan.
  • Results Return – At the end of your last day we are going to go over some of the results that we collected so that you have something to take away

A few risks associated with this study include:

  • Skin irritation, redness, or bruising (e.g. from blood draw, IV….)
  • Disruption of sleep or fatigue, emotional distress (e.g. due to sleep study, neuropsych testing)
  • Radiation exposure from the PET/CT, x-ray and DEXA scans
  • Muscle soreness, lightheadedness, nausea or fainting (e.g. during physical assessments and cardiac exercise testing)

Are you still interested in hearing more about the study or do you have any questions at this time?

Would you be willing to perform a brief cognitive task and answer questions about your health and medical history to find out if you might qualify for the study? This should take about 30 minutes and you will receive a $20 gift card for your time. Do you have time now to continue?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa notification layout
associated_message_templates.template:
IPA App Message Notification

{{main_content}}
If you received this email in error, please contact fphsetl@hms.harvard.edu to ensure we can update our records appropriately.

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call eligible 1
associated_message_templates.template: The study doctors have reviewed the information you provided and determined that you have met the criteria to participate in the study. Is this something you are still interested in participating in?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call intro
associated_message_templates.template:
Hello, may I please speak to Mr. {{player_info.last_name}}?

My name is XX, and I am calling (or following up) from the Football Players Health Study at Harvard University in regards to our in-person assessment. Is this a good time to speak?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call eligible 2
associated_message_templates.template:
Would you like me to review the details about the study again?

The study will take place at multiple hospitals in the Boston area over 2 1/2 days with overnight stays at a local hotel. Each day will consist of different testing. You will be provided with your personal study visit schedule ahead of your visit. You will be given breaks and meals throughout the days.

You will be assigned a study navigator, a member of the Football Players Health Study staff, who will accompany you throughout each day of the study. The navigator will assure that you get to each test. They will also handle scheduling issues or conflicts and provide assistance and act as a resource to you throughout the study.

Your mornings will begin between 7-8am and will end around 6-9pm, depending on the schedule for that particular day. Each day will begin with a review of that day’s schedule and any questions you may have will be answered. Each day will end with a review of how the procedures went. We may contact you after you complete the study visit with additional questions and follow-up.

The first day of the study a study navigator will greet you and a study physician will review the consent form with you and help to answer any questions that you have. A nurse practitioner will conduct a baseline physical exam and collect information about your health and medical history. Over the next two and a half days, you will undergo assessments such as PET/CT scans, sense of smell test, neuropsychological testing, MRI scans, physical function assessments, TMS and EEG, an overnight sleep study, cardiac testing, pain assessments, and an X-ray exam.

Compensation up to $1800 will be given to you for your time and efforts involved in participating in this study. In order to pay you, you will need to provide your Social Security Number (SSN) or Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (ITIN). Your payment will be processed 30 days after the study visit. You will need to fill out a W9 and any other pertinent tax information in order to receive payment.

Just as a reminder, we will cover the costs of your transportation, (parking), lodging and meals during the study visit. (ask where they are coming from)

Do you have any questions?

What dates work the best for you to travel to Boston?

show appointments

[offer dates and log in Athena]

Thank you for your time today.

We will send you additional study information to review and our travel partners will be contacting you to make arrangements for your visit to Boston.

Please feel free to contact us at any time should you have any questions.

END CALL

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call not eligible
associated_message_templates.template:
The Football Players Health Study at Harvard University appreciates your interest in participating in this study. The study doctors have reviewed the information you have provided and have determined that the in-person assessments study is not a good fit for you. As a reminder, simply because you are not a good fit for this particular study does not mean that you will not have the opportunity to participate in other Football Players Health Study research studies. Do we have permission to contact you in the future?

Thank you for your continued support of the Football Players Health Study and we look forward to hearing from you in the future.

Confirm contact information and END CALL.

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro complete intro
associated_message_templates.template:
There are some questions about sensitive medical information involved and some of the questions may make you feel uncomfortable. I will also be asking you to do some tasks in order to assess your attention and memory such as repeating sentences or numbers back to me. You can stop at any time.

I will record your answers on a secure database, and we will keep these answers even if you decide that you don’t want to continue in the study. This information will be stored in our secure database and may be combined with other information from other Football Players Health Studies that you have been involved in. If you do qualify for this study, we will collect detailed information to schedule your visit such as your date of birth, insurance information, an emergency contact, and address. This information will be discarded if you decide that you don’t want to be in this study. The risk of allowing us to collect and record your name with your answers is a loss of confidentiality. We will take reasonable steps to protect the confidentiality of your information.

As previously mentioned, you will receive a $20 gift card for your time today learning about the study and answering some questions about your health and medical history. Could you please provide me with and/or confirm your contact information so that I can send you this?

CHECK ATHENA (Participant Details Tab) FOR CORRECT CONTACT INFORMATION

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call needs partner
associated_message_templates.template:
If study subject meets eligibility criteria BUT is required to bring study partner

The Football Players Health Study at Harvard University appreciates your interest in participating in this study. The study doctors have reviewed your information and invite you to participate; however, they would like you to bring a study partner to Boston. This can be a spouse, adult child, your adult sibling, your parent or your legally authorized representative. We will cover all costs for your study partner to come with you. Do you have any questions?

If subject no longer wants to participate - thank them for their time, remind them they can participate in other FPHS research studies, and end call.

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro v2
associated_message_templates.template:
Hello, my name is ____, and I am calling from the Football Players Health Study at Harvard University. Is Mr. {{player_info.last_name}} available?

I am reaching out to talk to you about the In-Person Assessment research study. Is this still a good time to speak? During this call I will go over the study in more detail and if you are still interested in participating I will ask you to complete a brief cognitive task (for example – asking you to repeat and remember some words and numbers). I will also ask you some medical questions to see if it is safe for you to participate in the study. This should take about 45 minutes. Does this sound okay?

Voicemail

Hi, my name is ____ and I’m calling from the Football Players Health Study at Harvard University. When you have a chance please call me back at 617-432-5000. I look forward to speaking with you. Thank you

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro overview v2
associated_message_templates.template:
As you may know, The Football Players Health Study is a research initiative dedicated to understanding the current health and well-being of former NFL players. The research study that I want to talk to you about today is an In-Person study that focuses on four areas of player health that have been identified by former players such as yourself, as critical areas to be studied  – heart function, neurocognitive health (e.g. memory/thinking/problem solving and brain imaging), pain and physical function, and sleep. 

The purpose of this study is to obtain in-person measurements of these health conditions in former players. We hope that this will help us better understand the relationship of a professional football career to overall health. 

Participation will involve a 3 day study visit in Boston that includes assessments of the four areas. You will be compensated up to $1800 for participanting. All nights will be spent in a local hotel. The visits will take place at various Harvard-affiliated institutions. Throughout the study, a team of study navigators will guide you through all of the visits. All transportation, meal and lodging costs will be covered by the Study. Meals will be covered in the form of meal vouchers through the hospitals and reimbursements.  You will have the option of charging dinner to the hotel room or saving your dinner receipt for reimbursement.  The reimbursement and study payment checks will come in the mail 3-4 weeks after your visit.

By participating, you will be helping us better understand player health. Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to learn more about yourself as we will be providing results from some of the assessments at the end of the study. At your request, these can be shared with a health care provider for further guidance and interpretation. 

I am going to go over the study in some more detail. If you have any questions while I explain the study please stop me and ask.  Do you have any questions so far?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro details v2
associated_message_templates.template:
*INTERVIEWER: HAVE THE CONSENT FORM ON HAND TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL DETAILS ABOUT THE STUDY VISITS AS NEEDED.*

There are two potential schedules for the 3 day visit. 
Both schedules involve the same assessments, just in a different order from 
one another. Prior to your arrival in Boston, we will review the schedule 
options with you when coordinating your travel to see which option fits best.

We will be scheduling two participants to complete their study during the 
same time in Boston.  There is a chance that you could run into another 
study participant in the hotel lobby or at another time during the study.  
Due to confidentiality we would like to ask if it is okay with you to 
stay in the same hotel as another participant?  
If not, we can make arrangements for another hotel.

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro details sched a v2
associated_message_templates.template:
### Day 0


Our team will coordinate your arrival to Boston to arrive the day before the study begins.  You will check into a local hotel.   


### Day 1


Day 1 will begin at Mass General Hospital (MGH) where you will review the consent form with a study physician and study staff member.  Any specific questions you have will be answered then.  You will then go through a DEXA scan, which is similar to an x-ray but looks at bone density. Next, you will have your blood drawn and go through a general assessment of your health similar to a physical at a doctor’s appointment.  You will have to fast prior to this blood draw. In the afternoon, you will go through two PET scans, a sense of smell test and a test of your sensory responses.  The day will end around 6pm. 


- **Consent review:** The first day will start with a review of the consent. You will meet with a study coordinator and the study physician in order to review the study assessments and the consent form. During this time, you will be able to ask any questions or voice any concerns you may have.
- **DEXA:** Once you have agreed to participate, you will undergo a DEXA scan. A DEXA scan is similar to an x-ray, but it is a scan that looks at bone density and body composition. 
- **OGTT:** You will then get your blood drawn. Please note that will ask that you do not eat for at least 8 hours prior to this blood draw – we will be sure to remind you when you arrive. You will have breakfast following the blood draw.
- During the rest of the first day you will: 
  
    - Undergo an **assessment of your health** such as a review of your medical history, medications, and a brief physical exam that includes body composition measures (e.g. height, weight, waist size…)
    - Fill out some **questionnaires** about your health    
    - **PET** (Positron Emission Tomography) with **CT** (Computed Tomography) – PET/CT scans take pictures of what is going on inside the body using special dyes with radiation that “light up” inside the body to make a picture. The scanner is shaped like a big ring and you will be positioned on your back on the scanner table. The table may move forward and backward as part of the testing the procedures. You will complete two different PET scans. 
    - **Sense of smell testing** (olfactory)– This brief test consists of breathing different odors from a small handheld odor delivery device and being asked questions about your familiarity, memory and ability to name each odor.
    - **Sensory testing** – An assessment that consists of tests to measure your sensory responses – for example, having pressure applied to different parts of your body or putting you hand in ice water – you will be asked to report when these sensations are uncomfortable. 


### Day 2

On the second full study day, you will begin with neuropsychological testing.  After this, you will have an MRI of your brain and your liver.  In the afternoon, you will travel to a different hospital to do physical functioning testing.  After physical functioning, you will go through our TMS and EEG assessment.  TMS is noninvasive and uses magnetic fields to measure connectivity in the brain. After the TMS, you will return to the hotel to eat dinner, shower and change before the sleep study.  A sleep tech will set you up for the sleep assessment in your hotel room.  You will sleep with various sensors on your body to analyze your sleeping patterns. You will return the equipment to us in the morning.


- **Neuropsychological testing** – An assessment that consists of tests that evaluate your mood, memory and how you think, learn and solve problems. This will be conducted with a trained neuropsychologist.
- **MRI** (Magnetic resonance imaging) _of your brain and liver_ – This is a scan that takes pictures of your brain and liver using a large magnet and radio signals.
- **Physical function testing** – Testing that consists of a series of tests such as lifting weights, a timed walking test, walking upstairs carrying weights, walking while doing another task (simple math), and testing your balance. These assessments will be administered and overseen by a trained exercise physiologist.
- **TMS** (Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation) and **EEG** (Electroencephalogram)  – The TMS will measure brain plasticity. Brain plasticity is the ability of the brain to change and learn through experience. TMS is a noninvasive way of stimulating the brain. TMS uses a magnetic field to cause activity in the brain. The magnetic field is produced by a coil that is held next to your scalp. In this study, we will use TMS to create activity in your brain and will measure your brain’s response to the activity. This is how we measure brain plasticity. During the TMS assessment, you will have a series of electrodes (small round discs) will be placed on your head and your brain waves will be measured while you sit quietly and then while you complete a few simple tasks on a computer. 
- **Sleep study** – During the second night, you will have a sleep study in your hotel room.  This will include having sensors placed on your body to monitor your movement, heart rate, breathing and brain waves while you sleep. A trained technician will assist you in placing various sensors on your body, but they will leave you for the night. Additionally, you will be asked to complete several questionnaires on your sleep habits.



### Day 3

On the third and final study day, you will begin with a cardiac testing and then X-rays.  After you have completed all of the assessments, we will be returning some preliminary results from your testing.  Our medical navigation nurse and study doctor will meet with you and discuss some of the results.  Additional results will be reported to you in the coming weeks and that process will be explained to you at that time.


- **Cardiac testing** – This testing consists of activities such as having pictures taken of your heart (ultrasound), assessment of your resting metabolic rate which will include you having to wear light headgear with a breathing tube, and a bicycle exercise test.
- **X-rays** – You will undergo an X-ray exam, where you will be asked several questions, prepped and asked to stand in the equipment for the duration of the scan. 
- **Results Return** – At the end of your last day we are going to go over some of the results that we collected so that you have something to take away



A few risks associated with this study include: 


- Skin irritation, redness, or bruising  (e.g. from blood draw, IV….)
- Disruption of sleep or fatigue, emotional distress (e.g. due to sleep study, neuropsych testing)
- Radiation exposure from the PET/CT, x-ray and DEXA scans 
- Muscle soreness, lightheadedness, nausea or fainting (e.g. during physical assessments and cardiac exercise testing)



Are you still interested in hearing more about the study or do you have any questions at this time?

---

Would you be willing to perform a brief cognitive task and answer questions about your health and medical history to find out if you might qualify for the study?  This should take about 30 minutes and you will receive a $20 gift card for your time.  Do you have time now to continue?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro details sched b v2
associated_message_templates.template:

After the neuropsychological testing you will have lunch and travel back to MGH for two PET scans.  In between the PET scans you will complete two assessments, a sense of smell test and a test of your sensory responses. - **Neuropsychological testing** – An assessment that consists of tests that evaluate your mood, memory and how you think, learn and solve problems. This will be conducted with a trained neuropsychologist.
- **PET** (Positron Emission Tomography) with **CT** (Computed Tomography) – PET/CT scans take pictures of what is going on inside the body using special dyes with radiation that “light up” inside the body to make a picture. The scanner is shaped like a big ring and you will be positioned on your back on the scanner table. The table may move forward and backward as part of the testing the procedures. You will complete two different PET scans.

- **Sleep study** – During the second night, you will have a sleep study in your hotel room.  This will include having sensors placed on your body to monitor your movement, heart rate, breathing and brain waves while you sleep. A trained technician will assist you in placing various sensors on your body, but they will leave you for the night. Additionally, you will be asked to complete several questionnaires on your sleep habits.



### Day 3

On the third and final day you will travel to a different hospital and begin with the TMS and EEG assessment.  TMS is noninvasive and uses magnetic fields to measure connectivity in the brain.  You will then have a break for lunch and some down time.  In the afternoon you will complete the physical function testing.  After you have completed all of the assessments, we will be returning some preliminary results from your testing.  Our medical navigation nurse and study doctor will meet with you and discuss some of the results.  Additional results will be reported to you in the coming weeks and that process will be explained to you at that time.  The day will end around 6pm.

Brain plasticity is the ability of the brain to change and learn through experience. TMS is a noninvasive way of stimulating the brain. TMS uses a magnetic field to cause activity in the brain. This is how we measure brain plasticity. These assessments will be administered and overseen by a trained exercise physiologist.

associated_config_libraries.name: enabled_if
associated_config_libraries.options:
_definitions:

  enabled_if: &enabled_if

    # if performed a phone screening no consent to continue, disable after 14 days
    not_all_not_interested:
      any:
        dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screenings:
          select_is_good_time_to_speak: not interested
          select_may_i_begin: not interested
          select_still_interested: 'no'

      all_created_at:
        dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screenings:
          created_at:
            condition: <
            value: -14 days

    # if recorded a withdraw activity, disable after 14 days
    not_all_withdraw:
      any:
        dynamic_model__ipa_withdrawals:
          select_subject_withdrew_reason: withdrew
          select_investigator_terminated:
            - yes - due to ae
            - yes - other reason
          lost_to_follow_up_no_yes: 'yes'
          no_longer_participating_no_yes: 'yes'
      all_created_at:
        dynamic_model__ipa_withdrawals:
          created_at:
            condition: <
            value: -14 days

    # if performed a screening follow up and not eligible, disable after 14 days
    not_all_ineligible:
      dynamic_model__ipa_screenings:
        eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no: 'no'
        created_at:
          condition: <
          value: -14 days

    # if performed a screening follow up and not interested in participating, disable after 14 days
    not_all_ps_followup_not_interested:
      dynamic_model__ipa_screenings:
        still_interested_blank_yes_no: 'no'
        created_at:
          condition: <
          value: -14 days

    # if an exit or lost to follow up before scheduled, disable after 14 days
    not_all_tracker_exits:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type:
          - exit_opt_out
          - exit_l2fu
          # if the exit survey has been completed, do not disable after 14 days
          #- completed
        created_at:
          condition: <
          value: -14 days

  ref_filestore_container: &ref_filestore_container
    nfs_store__manage__container: &ref_nfs_store__manage__container
      from: this
      add: one_to_this
      view_as:
        edit: hide
        show: filestore
        new: not_embedded
      creatable_if:
        never: true

  save_trigger:
    on_create_filestore_container: &create_filestore_container
      create_filestore_container:
        name: general files
        label: General Files
        create_with_role: nfs_store group 600



  any_exit_or_complete: &any_exit_or_complete
    any_exit_or_complete:
      any_exit: &any_exit
        any_tracker_exits: &any_tracker_exit
          activity_log__ipa_assignments:
            extra_log_type:
              - exit_opt_out
              - exit_l2fu
              - completed
        any_withdrawal: &any_withdrawal
          dynamic_model__ipa_withdrawals:
            no_longer_participating_no_yes: 'yes'
            lost_to_follow_up_no_yes: 'yes'
            select_subject_withdrew_reason: withdrew
            select_investigator_terminated:
              - yes - due to ae
              - yes - other reason

      all_completed: &all_completed
        activity_log__ipa_assignments:
          extra_log_type: completed

associated_config_libraries.name: filestore_container
associated_config_libraries.options:
_definitions:

  ref_filestore_container: &ref_filestore_container
    nfs_store__manage__container: &ref_nfs_store__manage__container
      from: this
      add: one_to_this
      view_as:
        edit: hide
        show: filestore
        new: not_embedded
      creatable_if:
        never: true
        
  save_trigger:
    on_create_filestore_container: &create_filestore_container
      create_filestore_container: 
        name: general files
        label: General Files
        create_with_role: nfs_store group 600



  files_activity: &files_activity
    label: Supporting Files
    fields:
      - notes

    caption_before:
      notes: Describe the files in this container. Individual files can also be given a title and description in the file classifications.

    creatable_if:
      <<: *enabled_if

    editable_if:
      <<: *enabled_if

    save_trigger:
      on_create:
        <<: *create_filestore_container

    references:
      nfs_store__manage__container:
        <<: *ref_nfs_store__manage__container

notes - tag_select_contact_role - prev_activity_type - created_by_user_id field_options: &start_discussion_field_options notes: edit_as: field_type: subject prev_activity_type: edit_as: field_type: fixed_type value: this: extra_log_type: return_value show_if: prev_activity_type: never: true created_by_user_id: never: true valid_if: on_save: not_any: this: subject: '' labels: tag_select_contact_role: notify role caption_before: &setup_discussion_caption_before all_fields: | Setup a discussion to securely contact the selected roles. Messages are visible, and notifications sent to only the users with the selected roles (and the creator of the discussion: {{created_by_user_email}}). To change this visibility, and future notifications, edit this discussion before sending new messages. notes: edit_caption: | Enter subject of the discussion *Do not enter any PII or PHI in this field, since it will be included in notification emails* show_caption: Subject tag_select_contact_role: |
Roles to be included

Roles will enable access and notify specific users

  • Phone Screen Interviewer: the staff member that started phone screen interview
  • All Phone Screeners: all staff members that may perform phone screen interviews
  • Clinical Research Coordinator: the Clinical Research Coordinator for the project
  • Navigator: all staff members with the role of Navigator
  • Med Nav: the Medical Navigator for the project
  • TMS: all users in the TMS group
  • PI: the Principal Investigator

associated_config_libraries.name: notify_roles
associated_config_libraries.options:
_definitions:


  ####
  # Boilerplace for notifying roles
  # Directly call in a trigger like:
  #
  # save_trigger:
  #   on_create:
  #     notify: &notify_hms_ps
  #
  ####

  ###########

  # Creator
  notify_discussion_creator_option: &notify_discussion_creator
    <<: *notify_email_default
    users:
      referring_record:
        user_id: return_value

  # Creator SMS
  notify_discussion_creator_option_sms: &notify_discussion_creator_sms
    <<: *notify_sms_default
    users:
      referring_record:
        user_id: return_value

  ###########

  # Phone Screen Interviewer
  notify_ps_int: &notify_ps_int
    <<: *notify_email_default
    users:
      dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screenings:
        user_id: return_value

  notify_ps_int_sms: &notify_ps_int_sms
    <<: *notify_sms_default
    users:
      dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screenings:
        user_id: return_value

  ###########

  # All Phone Screen Interviewers
  notify_ps_int: &notify_all_ps
    <<: *notify_email_default
    role: email - phone screener
    
  notify_ps_int_sms: &notify_all_ps_sms
    <<: *notify_sms_default
    role: sms - phone screener
    
  ###########

  # Navigators
  notify_navigators: &notify_navigators
    <<: *notify_email_default
    role: email - navigator

  notify_navigators_sms: &notify_navigators_sms
    <<: *notify_sms_default
    role: sms - navigator

  ###########

  # Clinical Research Coordinator
  notify_crc: &notify_crc
    <<: *notify_email_default
    role: email - crc

  notify_crc_sms: &notify_crc_sms
    <<: *notify_sms_default
    role: sms - crc

  ###########

  # Med Nav
  notify_med_nav: &notify_med_nav
    <<: *notify_email_default
    role: email - mednav

  notify_med_nav_sms: &notify_med_nav_sms
    <<: *notify_sms_default
    role: sms - mednav

  ###########

  # TMS
  notify_tms: &notify_tms
    <<: *notify_email_default
    role: email - tms

  notify_tms_sms: &notify_tms_sms
    <<: *notify_sms_default
    role: sms - tms

  ###########  

  # PI
  notify_pi: &notify_pi
    <<: *notify_email_default
    role: email - pi

  # PI SMS
  notify_pi_sms: &notify_pi_sms
    <<: *notify_sms_default
    role: sms - pi

  ###########

  # HMS Admin
  notify_hms_admin: &notify_hms_admin
    <<: *notify_email_default
    role: email - hms admin

  # HMS Admin SMS
  notify_hms_admin_sms: &notify_hms_admin_sms
    <<: *notify_sms_default
    role: sms - hms admin

associated_config_libraries.name: notification_base
associated_config_libraries.options:
_definitions:


  ####
  # Base Boilerplace for notifying roles
  # Add role or users attributes
  # Override the subject: and if: structures to refine operation
  ####

  # Default email - just add roles or users
  notify_email_default: &notify_email_default
    type: email
    layout_template: ipa notification layout
    content_template: ipa notification message
    role:
    subject: "IPA App: Notification message"
    extra_substitutions:
      reason: ''
      extra_text: ''
      panel_tab: none


  # Default SMS - just add roles or users
  notify_sms_default: &notify_sms_default
    type: sms
    layout_template: standard sms layout
    content_template: ipa sms notification
    role:
    subject: "IPA Notification"
